title: Make the fleeing “No” button work on Android/iOS without showing any popup overlay

requirements.text: Remove the “No” confirmation popup/message box behavior entirely. Clicking/tapping the “No” button must not open any overlay/modal; instead, the “No” button must only perform the fleeing/moving behavior.

quotes: make this feature workable for all user like android and ios both too dont give a message box just make the no button moving like it works in desktop

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, clicking the “No” button does not open any overlay/modal and does not show any confirmation UI.
The component `NoConfirmationOverlay` is not rendered anywhere in the app (no UI, no state toggles that display it).
There are no remaining user-facing strings related to the removed confirmation overlay (e.g., “Are you REALLY sure?”) displayed anywhere in the UI.

requirements.text: Update the fleeing “No” button interaction so it works on touch devices (Android/iOS) as well as desktop. On touch devices, the “No” button must move away when the user attempts to interact with it (e.g., touch start / pointer down), achieving the same comedically hard-to-click effect as desktop hover/approach behavior.

quotes: make this feature workable for all user like android and ios both too

acceptanceCriteria: On iOS Safari/Chrome and Android Chrome, attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to move away before a click action can be completed (or otherwise prevents a stable successful tap).
On desktop, the existing flee-on-approach behavior continues to work (e.g., via pointer movement near the button).
The “No” button remains visible within the viewport after moving (it must not move off-screen).
The interaction does not rely on hover-only events; it must be triggered via pointer/touch-capable events on mobile.

requirements.text: Remove or refactor any now-unused code paths and imports introduced solely to support the removed “No” confirmation overlay, ensuring the codebase has no dead references to `NoConfirmationOverlay` or its related state/handlers.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/App.tsx` no longer imports or conditionally renders `NoConfirmationOverlay`, and no longer keeps state solely for showing/hiding it.
There are no unused imports/variables related to the removed overlay (TypeScript build/lint passes without unused-symbol errors in the modified files).

constraints: Do not edit files under the immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui).
Keep the Valentine page compatible with mobile browsers (Android and iOS) and maintain the existing minimal-dependency approach.
Do not add or display any additional image assets; preserve the existing constraint that the app displays only the single allowed generated image asset (if present elsewhere in the project).
nonGoals: Adding any new confirmation dialogs, popups, toasts, or message boxes for the “No” flow.
Changing the “Yes” flow behavior or adding new Valentine interactions unrelated to the fleeing “No” button.
Backend changes (this is a frontend-only interaction change).
